metadata.Title: CVE-2015-3210 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in PCRE 8.34 through 8.37 and PCRE2 10.10 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted regular expression, as demonstrated by /^(?P=B)((?P=B)(?J:(?P<B>c)(?P<B>a(?P=B)))>WGXCREDITS)/, a different vulnerability than CVE-2015-8384.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-3210` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpcre3 - 1:8.31-2ubuntu2
libpcrecpp0 - 1:8.31-2ubuntu2
pcregrep - 1:8.31-2ubuntu2
No subscription required

notes.Note: seth-arnold> "A number of such bugs have recently been discovered by fuzzers", it might be a good idea to trawl the source repo for more such fixes. mdeslaur> Debian claims introduced in http://vcs.pcre.org/pcre?view=revision&revision=1361  was supposed to be fixed in wily (2:8.35-7ubuntu2) but got reverted in (2:8.35-7ubuntu5) by mistake  CVE-2015-2325_CVE-2015-2326_CVE-2015-3210_CVE-2015-5073.patch in jessie

criterions.comment: pcre3 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:8.31-2ubuntu2').
